text: I think we both feel that you know
Minnesota's being progressive with their
lives not just with the same-sex
marriage laws but with just a lot of
different issues and we feel it
Wisconsin's went backwards
Alvin Berg and Vince Nelson have been a
couple for 29 years they own two gay
nightclubs one in superior Wisconsin and
another right across state lines in
Duluth Minnesota
they live in superior but when Minnesota
passed same-sex marriage last May they
started to wonder if they're living in
the wrong state
we never thought much about just living
on the other side of the bridge in
Wisconsin but once the marriage thing
happened it means a lot to us too to
live in a state that recognizes us
I'm Monica Devi for the New York Times
the Twin Ports of Duluth Minnesota and
superior Wisconsin sit roughly five
miles apart sharing the same steady
chill off Lake Superior residents on
both sides have long crossed back and
forth
without much thought about which state
they're in but ever since Democrats
gained sole control over Minnesota state
government and Republicans over
Wisconsin's they're finding their lives
diverging a record 36 States 23
Republican and 13 Democratic now operate
under single-party rule making it easier
than ever to pass partisan agendas on
issues like gay rights gun control
abortion and taxes America is
increasingly a nation divided so this is
a place where you can see really well
both sides of this border all over here
you've got superior Wisconsin and right
here behind me you've got Duluth
Minnesota and it's really a single
community in some ways and they call it
the Twin Ports and people you know live
and work on both sides of this
in Duluth Minnesota I toured the ME elec
metal foundry which produces castings
from milling hard rock minerals we spent
in 2011 and 2012 a little over twenty
three and a half million dollars in what
we called optimizing the facility
basically taking bottlenecks out of the
facility
to streamline it and then adding
capacity andy fulton says a generous tax
rebate from the state made this
expansion more feasible but last year
when Minnesota's government became all
Democratic it imposed a series of new
business taxes so my twenty three and a
half million dollars wouldn't go as far
the next time we were to to do an
expansion and if the law had changed
earlier we might have looked at that
investment differently Emme elec Mattel
is not about to pick up and move its
twenty acre campus across state lines
but Fulton thinks the tax laws passed by
Democrats in Minnesota could discourage
other businesses from settling in the
state it is a good state it has many
many positive benefits to it and there's
nothing wrong with paying taxes to
support that but there comes to a point
when the layering of taxes just becomes
too onerous for business
but for Vince Nelson and Alvin Berg
Minnesota offers personal freedom as
soon as they find a house they plan to
move to Duluth and then they'll get
married I said well when the day comes
when I can get married where I live I'll
get married and seeing I'm only five
miles away now from being able to do
that that's my reasoning
